entities.name: luna lovegood
entities.description: Luna Lovegood is mentioned as a character who can see the bat-winged horses. She is described as having silvery eyes and being able to see them since her first day at Hogwarts.

entities.name: ron weasley
entities.description: Ron Weasley is mentioned as a character who cannot see the bat-winged horses. He is described as looking worried about Harry and making a joke about it.

entities.name: harry potter
entities.description: Harry Potter is mentioned as a character who can see the bat-winged horses but is unsure if he is going mad. He is described as looking worried and desperate for reassurance from Luna.

entities.name: bat-winged horses
entities.description: The bat-winged horses are mentioned as being able to pull carriages. They are described as being visible to Luna but not to Ron or Harry.

relationships.description: Harry is reassured by Luna that he is sane and can see the bat-winged horses. This is described in the text as Luna telling Harry 'You're just as sane as I am'.
Harry can see the bat-winged horses. This is described in the text as Harry being able to 'see them too'.
Luna can see the bat-winged horses. This is described in the text as Luna saying 'I've been able to see them ever since my first day here'.
Ron cannot see the bat-winged horses. This is described in the text as Ron saying 'I don't know what you're talking about'.
